content.text:
# List of international presidential trips made by Gamal Abdel Nasser

The following list details the international visits undertaken during the presidency of Gamal Abdel Nasser, spanning from 1954 until his death in 1970.
1955
{| class="wikitable sortable"
|-
! # !! Country !! Cities Visited !! Date(s) !! Purpose !! Event/Occasion !! Notable Figures Met !! Region !! Ref
|-
| rowspan="3" | 1 ||  || Karachi || April 1955 || Transit & bilateral talks || Bilateral visit before Bandung || Mohammad Ali Bogra || Asia ||
|-
|  || Rangoon || April 1955  || Goodwill stopover || Thingyan New Year Celebration || U Nu, Jawaharlal Nehru || Asia ||
|-
|  || Bandung || 18–24 April 1955 || Attend summit || Bandung Conference || Jawaharlal Nehru, Zhou Enlai, Sukarno || Asia ||
|-
|}
1956
{| class="wikitable sortable"
|-
! # !! Country !! Cities Visited !! Date(s) !! Purpose !! Event/Occasion !! Notable Figures Met !! Region !! Ref
|-
| 2 ||  || Jeddah || April 1956 || Trilateral summit || Signing of Arab defense pact with Saudi Arabia and Yemen || King Saud and Imam Ahmad bin Yahya || Arab world ||
|-
| 3 ||  || Belgrade, Brijuni || 13–19 July 1956 || State visit & summit || Brioni Meeting || Josip Broz Tito, Jawaharlal Nehru || Europe ||
|-
| 4 ||  || Dhahran || 22 September 1965 || State visit || || || Arab world ||
|}
1958
{| class="wikitable sortable"
|-
! # !! Country !! Cities Visited !! Date(s) !! Purpose !! Event/Occasion !! Notable Figures Met !! Region !! Ref
|-
| 5 ||  || Damascus || 22 February 1958 || Union declaration || Formation of UAR || Shukri al-Quwatli || Arab world ||
|-
| 6 ||  || Moscow || Apr–May 1958 || State visit || May Day & diplomatic talks || Nikita Khrushchev || Europe ||
|-
| 7 ||  || Belgrade || July 1958 || Diplomatic talks || Consultation || Josip Broz Tito || Europe ||
|}
1960
{| class="wikitable sortable"
|-
! # !! Country !! Cities Visited !! Date(s) !! Purpose !! Event/Occasion !! Notable Figures Met !! Region !! Ref
|-
| 8 ||  || New Delhi || Mar–Apr 1960 || State visit || Diplomatic talks || Nehru, Rajendra Prasad || Asia ||
|-
| 9 ||  || Athens || 7–9 June 1960 || State visit || Diplomatic meetings || King Paul I || Europe ||
|-
| 10 ||  || New York || September 1960 || UNGA participation || 15th UN General Assembly || Dwight Eisenhower, Nikita Khrushchev, Jawaharlal Nehru, Josip Broz Tito, and Fidel Castro || North America ||
|}
1961
{| class="wikitable sortable"
|-
! # !! Country !! Cities Visited !! Date(s) !! Purpose !! Event/Occasion !! Notable Figures Met !! Region !! Ref
|-
| 11 ||  || Belgrade || 1–6 September 1961 || Attend summit || 1st Non-Aligned Movement Summit || Josip Broz Tito, Jawaharlal Nehru || Europe ||
|}
1963
{| class="wikitable sortable"
|-
! # !! Country !! Cities Visited !! Date(s) !! Purpose !! Event/Occasion !! Notable Figures Met !! Region !! Ref
|-
| 12 ||  || Algiers || 6 May 1963 || State visit || || Ahmed Ben Bella || Arab world ||
|-
| 13 ||  || Addis Ababa || 24 May 1963 || Attend summit || OAU Founding Summit || Haile Selassie || Africa ||
|-
| 14 ||  || Belgrade || July 1963 || Diplomatic talks || Bilateral discussions || Josip Broz Tito || Europe ||
|-
| 15 ||  || Bizerte || December 1963 || Attend independence event || French withdrawal from Bizerte || Habib Bourguiba || Arab world ||
|}

|-
! # !! Country !! Cities Visited !! Date(s) !! Purpose !! Event/Occasion !! Notable Figures Met !! Region !! Ref

| 16 ||  || Sanaa || March 1964 || State visit || Support for Republican government || Abdullah al-Sallal || Arab world ||
|}
